com.tsgrp.migration.util

Class RosettaDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.util.RosettaDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rosetta

    public class RosettaDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rosetta
    Rosetta class which translates strings stored in a database.

      • setSynchronizeAdds

        public void setSynchronizeAdds(boolean value)
        Injected, OPTIONAL; if set, calls to addTranslation will block across threads (defaults to true). Otherwise, adds do not block and are not threadsafe (but will be faster, and better in cases where we know two threads will never contend for an oldValue).

      • setLoadCacheAtInit

        public void setLoadCacheAtInit(boolean value)
        Injected, OPTIONAL; if set, loads entire Rosetta into cache during #init (defaults to false). Not advised for large tables!

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize JDBC connection, then read entire table into cache. TODO: Allow this to be controlled/overridden/etc. for very large Rosettas.
        Specified by:
        init in interface Rosetta

      • translate

        public java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String oldString)
        Given an string, returns a translated new String; if it cannot be translated, return it as-is.
        Specified by:
        translate in interface Rosetta
        Parameters:
        oldString - The string to be translated
        Returns:
        Returns the oldString's new String representation, or oldString if no match found
        See Also:
        Rosetta.translate(java.lang.String)

      • translate

        public java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String oldString,
                                  java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Given an string, returns a translated new String; if it cannot be translated, return defaultValue. Check cache first, then database.
        Specified by:
        translate in interface Rosetta
        Parameters:
        oldString - The string to be translated
        defaultValue - Returned if no match found.
        Returns:
        Returns the oldString's new String representation, or defaultValue if no match found
        See Also:
        Rosetta.translate(java.lang.String)

      • addTranslation

        public boolean addTranslation(java.lang.String oldString,
                              java.lang.String newString)
        Insert or Update a translation, synchronizing if #synchronizeAdds is set.
        Specified by:
        addTranslation in interface Rosetta
        Parameters:
        oldString - String to be translated
        newString - New representation of oldString
        Returns:
        true if translation already existed and waS UPDATED; or false if one was INSERTED
        See Also:
        Rosetta.addTranslation(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • doAddTranslation

        protected boolean doAddTranslation(java.lang.String oldString,
                                   java.lang.String newString)
        Insert or Update a translation, using prepared statement. Implementation method for addTranslation(String, String), which determines whether to synchronize or not.
        Returns:
        true if translation already existed and waS UPDATED; or false if one was INSERTED
